Author: ph0rque
Content: This is what we did in my previous start-up: we wrote up the process of all that we were doing, then researched as much as possible about what kinds of patents already existed in our field, and rewrote what we had to avoid infringing on those. The research was the hardest part, but now http://www.google.com/patents should be a big help. Then, we took what we had to a lawyer and asked him for advice. He ended up helping us file the prov. for less than $400.

Title: Some Times You Have to Roll Your Own

Content: For me it is the news..get the right buzz at the right time.

Author: rms
Content:
It should cost less than $500, I believe the filing fee is $125. Getting a lawyer involved will increase the price by several thousand.

I'd recommend the Nolo Press books on the topic. http://www.nolo.com/product.cfm/ObjectID/1F0E4794-D236-43C3-... You can buy the pdf online or if you don't mind violating international copyright law they're mostly available on emule.

Author: mhidalgo
Content: ocw.mit.edu is where MIT keeps alot of their material for their CS classes, also Berkeley's webcast has video of their classes for each semester.
